Note: the original prices are in CHF (Swiss Francs)
Run DHCPv6 Manually Invoke Refresh
This app is written and created by Anastassios Martakos

What does this app do?
This app gets an IPv6 address over DHCPv6.

Issue:
Android currently only supports SLAAC (Stateless Address Autoconfiguration) in IPv6 networks and no DHCPv6. Read more: https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=32621
For this reason I did some research and created this app.

Detailed Explanation:
Fairphone (Enterprise) has a DHCPv6 client implementation in their Android ROM. I went through their source and took their DHCPv6 binary. Although Fairphone uses the wide-dhcpv6 client (http://wide-dhcpv6.sourceforge.net/), they have written their own scripts around the binary. Simply taking the source of wide-dhcpv6 and compiling it for arm won't work but it is possible to compile the binary and then using the scripts from Fairphone.

What does this app do?
This app starts the Fairphones DHCPv6 client every time the phone connects to a WiFi network (or any network, you can configure this) and gets an IPv6 address over DHCPv6.

Communicating with the DHCPv6 Client binary
This app listens with a broadcast receiver to network changes. Every time you connect to a network (any network it is configurable through the advanced menu in the settings) it invokes a communicator binary (dhcp6ctl) to communicate with the master process (dhcp6c), this master process is automatically invoked by this app if it is not running, to get an IPv6 address using DHCPv6.

Do I need this app?
Yes, if you want to access IPv6 networks with DHCP address distribution. This app makes you future-proof

Troubleshooting:
It asks me if I want to install the DHCPv6 client every time I start the app - Update your busybox
I dont get an IPv6 address - Verify that you have IPv6 available in your network, then disable and enable WiFi, reboot your phone
The app freezes for some time - Please report when und where, although it should continue working after a while
Other issues - Open an isse on github: https://github.com/realmar/DHCPv6-Client-Android/issues

Credits:
Anastassios Martakos - Developing this app
Fairphone (https://www.fairphone.com/) - providing the source of their ROM
Google - For their Android icon set (https://www.google.com/design/icons/index.html)

Used binaries (licences may apply):
WIDE-DHCPv6 (http://wide-dhcpv6.sourceforge.net/) - Providing the source of their DHCP client

Source Code: https://github.com/realmar/DHCPv6-Client-Android

Support:
Please open an issue on github: https://github.com/realmar/DHCPv6-Client-Android/issues You can now manually run the DHCPv6 client for ONE TIME (invoke manually once) on the interfaces you specified above. For Automated invocation refer to the settings page. (The DHCPv6 client is invoked automatically as specified in the settings page)
Thank you SO much for donating! There was an error with your purchase
Open navigation drawer Close navigation drawer
It seems that your phone is based on the armv8 architecture which has 64-bit support.
Although the DHCPv6 SHOULD work anyway but there is a slight chance that it doesn't.

This is just a warning so you can ignore it because your system should be multiarch.string> It seems that your phone is based on a x86 or x86_64 architecture. This architecture is currently not supported.
Although there is a slight chance that the DHCPv6 client might work, give it a try.string>
Could not connect to Google Play Services. Please retry in a few seconds. Or reopen donation page. There was an error with your purchase: Thank you SO much for donating!
Trying to get an IPv6 on:
Failed to acquire root access It seems that you have no root permissions on your device, this software will not work without root. Only showing assigned IP addresses. Busybox not found It seems that you have Busybox not installed, this is a requirement Commands missing It seems that some required commands are missing. Please verify, that all commands mentioned at the bottom are available in /system/bin.

You can achieve this by using adb and standard unix command line tools.

Also you can reinstall busybox or try a different version of busybox.

You can also open an issue on github: https://github.com/realmar/DHCPv6-Client-Android/issues
I'm happy to help you there.


Couldn't verify files, please try again or open an issue and describe your problem on github: https://github.com/realmar/DHCPv6-Client-Android/issues Couldn't create files, please try again or open an issue and describe your problem on github: https://github.com/realmar/DHCPv6-Client-Android/issues Couldn't copy files, please try again or open an issue and describe your problem on github: https://github.com/realmar/DHCPv6-Client-Android/issues Unexpected error in installation, please try again or open an issue and describe your problem on github: https://github.com/realmar/DHCPv6-Client-Android/issues It seems that an error occurred, try again or open an issue and describe your problem on github: https://github.com/realmar/DHCPv6-Client-Android/issues
DHCPv6 Client update Available Touch here to update the DHCPv6 Client (This update is required in order for the client to work)
The DHCPv6 client was successfully installed The DHCPv6 client update was successfully installed
IP address copied to clipboard
DHCPv6 Client Update It seems that you recently updated this app.

With this new version it is required to install additional binaries in order for the client to work.
Do you want to install those binaries now? There is not enough space left on /system. Please delete some files which you don't need (eg. ringstones, apps, etc…) and try again Do you want to install the DHCPv6 client? Are you sure you want to uninstall the DHCPv6 client? 

Do you want to retry and download the required files from the internet? An active internet connection is required to download the files from the internet, please retry when you have an active and working internet connection.
The DHCPv6 client was successfully uninstalled It seems that an Error occurred, restart application
